javadoc:
This class represents an "or'able" condition in the DialogFilterConditionSet
@param <T> the column type.

params.comment: the parent condition that created this condition.

params.comment: the parent condition that created this condition.

params.comment: the constraint from an existing ColumnTableFilter.

methods.name: getColumnConstraints
methods.comment:
Returns a list of valid constraints for the column

 Used by the dialog to populate the constraint comboBox

return.comment: a list of valid constraints for the column.

methods.javadoc:
Change the constraint to the constraint with the given name.
@param constraintName the name of the constraint to change to.

methods.comment: Change the constraint to the constraint with the given name.

params.name: constraintName
params.comment: the name of the constraint to change to.

methods.javadoc:
Return the constraint from the editor.
@return the constraint from the editor.

methods.comment: Return the constraint from the editor.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the editor has a valid value.
@return true if the editor has a valid value.
methods.name: hasValidFilterValue
methods.comment: Returns true if the editor has a valid value.

return.comment: true if the editor has a valid value.

methods.name: getInlineEditorComponent
methods.comment:
Returns an editor component for use by the user to change the constraint value. This is the
 component that the dialog's filter panel will display inline with the constraint name.

return.comment: an editor component for use by the user to change the constraint value.

methods.name: getDetailEditorComponent
methods.comment:
For future expansion, a larger component may be allowed that will be displayed on an entire
 line below the constraint name.

return.comment: an editor component for use by the user to change the constraint value.

methods.javadoc:
Deletes this OrFilterCondition from its parent.  If it is the last one in the parent, the
 parent will then delete itself from its parent and so on.
methods.name: delete
methods.comment:
Deletes this OrFilterCondition from its parent.  If it is the last one in the parent, the
 parent will then delete itself from its parent and so on.

methods.name: setValue
methods.comment: Sets the constraint value from a string.  Used for testing.

params.name: valueString
params.comment: the constraint value as a string that will be parsed.

name: DialogFilterCondition
